graph_title: (a) Number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults and (b) number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
indicator_name: (a) Number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults and (b) number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: (a) Number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults and (b) number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
methodology_global: The number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults. The number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults. Computation Method: The indicators are calculated based on data collected directly from the Central Bank or the main financial regulator in the country. The formula to obtain those indicators are: The number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults=Number of commercial bank branches/Adult population/100,000. The number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults=Number of automated teller machines (ATMs)/Adult population/100,000.
SDG_GOAL: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
SDG_TARGET: Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all
SDG_INDICATOR: (a) Number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults and (b) number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
